gr.forth.ics.jbenchy
Interface DataType<T>

public interface DataType<T>

A data type, which can be mapped to both Java and SQL.

Author:
andreou

Method Summary
 java.lang.Class<T> getMappedType()
          Returns the Java type that this data type denotes.
 java.lang.String getName()
          Returns a name of this type.
 java.lang.String getSqlDefinition()
          Returns the SQL definition of this type.
 T parse(java.lang.String value)
          Parses a string to create a Java object, according to the semantics of this data type.
 java.lang.String toSql(java.lang.Object value)
          Returns a string, embeddable in an SQL query, that has the same value as the provided Java object.
 

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns a name of this type.

getSqlDefinition

java.lang.String getSqlDefinition()
Returns the SQL definition of this type. For example, an integer type would have a "INT" SQL definition.

getMappedType

java.lang.Class<T> getMappedType()
Returns the Java type that this data type denotes.

parse

T parse(java.lang.String value)
Parses a string to create a Java object, according to the semantics of this data type.

Parameters:
value - a textual value that is to be mapped onto a Java object
Returns:
a Java object that is the result of parsing the textual value, if that value is valid

toSql

java.lang.String toSql(java.lang.Object value)
Returns a string, embeddable in an SQL query, that has the same value as the provided Java object. For example, a string value would have to be enclosed in "'" characters.

Parameters:
value - the Java object to be rendered in SQL
Returns:
the string representation of the value that can be safely embedded in SQL
